result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Schelberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda L. Schelberger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda L. Schelberger was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Amanda L. Schelberger was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided
** Pay DNA surccharge.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

timeConds.notes: Huber and Work Crew authorized.   Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L. Schelberger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Amanda L. Schelberger, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Victim present in court and statement is given.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 3 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 10/31/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew privileges are authorized.   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cash bond on deposit is to be applied and if any bond remains it is to be returned to poster, otherwise any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Amanda L. Schelberger, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
Atty Breckenfelder states an offer has been received and requests more time to discuss offer as DE is currently in treatment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

1:51 pm   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel. Clerk:  NJ.  Plea of not guilty entered by the court.  Deft demands jury trial.  PTC 7-31-15 @ 1:40 & FPT 9-10-15 @ 8:50.  $850 cash bond contd posted with conditions.  Victim DM in court requesting contact.

Continued Posted
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Ian M or their residence(s).  No violent contact w. DM, No disucssion of case.
940.19(1) Battery, DV   /   943.01(1) Crim Damage to Property, DV   /   947.01(1) DC, DV
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA McNeill
and witness list filed by the State
